citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Deep Ocean Iron Levels, 1997-present

descript.abstract: Ambient dissolved and particulate iron levels in the deep ocean; part of a project to determine if iron is limiting to phytoplankton growth in the high-nutrient low chlorophyll waters of the subarctic Pacific Ocean. Surface-1000m
descript.purpose: Measurement of ambient levels of iron in the deep ocean in high-nutrient, low chlorophyll waters to determine if iron is limiting to phytoplankton growth.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Data not secured in regional data centre. Risk of Loss: Medium Impact Justification: Data are related to a subject, location or species of concern within the scientific, government or public community within the last 5 years. Impact of Loss: Medium Recommended Action: Obtain access to data and bring to archives. Additional Info: After the data are published, they may become available, if the Japanese collaborators agree to their release.

idinfo.useconst: Collaborative data collected with Japanese Scientists.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: Iron concentrations are compared to diluted, commercially prepared stock solutions. Duplicate samples are measured to obtain estimates of variability.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road
